0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte, Toenails: apply TOPICALLY to affected toenails once daily for 48 weeks; completely cover the toenail, including the undersurface, with each application

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: No specific contraindications or warnings have been identified.

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: No specific contraindications or warnings have been identified.

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Application site erythema (1.6%), Dermatitis, Application site (1.3%), Ingrowing toenail (2.5%), Peeling of skin, Application site (2.7%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Tavaborole is an oxaborole antifungal with inhibitory activity against aminoacyl-transfer ribonucleic acid synthetase.

3.title: Excretion
3.mono: Renal: primary excretion route; changed drug

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • topical use only; not for oral, ophthalmic, or intravaginal use
  • discard unused portion within 3 months of dropper insertion
  • contents are flammable; avoid heat or flame

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: improvement in the signs and symptoms of onychomycosis may indicate efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Avoid use near open flame or excessive heat as product is flammable.
  • Side effects may include ingrown toenail or application site dermatitis, erythema, or exfoliation.
  • Tell patient to report persistent irritation at application site (ie, redness, itching, swelling).
  • Advise patient to apply drug to entire surface of infected toenail as well as under the tip.
  • Instruct patient to clean and dry nails prior to administration. Allow solution to dry completely once applied.
  • Counsel patient to avoid contact with skin. Wipe away excess solution from surrounding skin.
  • Warn patient that drug is not for oral, ophthalmic, or intravaginal use.
